question: 腹
sourceAnswer: abdomen/belly/stomach | womb | one's-mind/one's-real-intentions/one's-true-motive | courage/nerve/willpower | generosity/magnanimity | feelings/emotions | wide-middle-part/bulging-part | inside/interior/inner-part | anti-node | counter-for-hard-roe | counter-for-containers-with-bulging-middles-(pots,-vases,-etc.)

activeAnswer: abdomen/belly | womb | one's-real-intentions | courage | generosity | feelings
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: If anyone ever tries to touch your <kanji>belly</kanji> make sure you yell "Seku<reading>hara</reading> (<ja>はら</ja>)! Sekuhara!” Sekuhara is short for sexual harassment in Japan. And if you don't want someone to touch your belly, but they're trying to, then that's sekuhara!
